result.markdown: --- title: "Colouring Text in ggplot2" execute: freeze: true eval: true format: html: highlight: true code-fold: show code-tools: true highlight-style: github --- # Colouring Text in ggplot2 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(ggtext) library(grid) library(glue) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mtcars %>% ggplot(aes( x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(cyl) )) + geom_point() + labs( x = "**wt**", y = "**mpg**", title = "Lower **wt** tends to increase the amount of **mpg**", colour = "" ) + theme( plot.title = element_markdown(), axis.title.x = element_markdown(), axis.title.y = element_markdown() ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](colouring_text_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Colouring one of interest ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} iris %>% group_by(Species) %>% summarise(mean_petal_width = mean(Petal.Width), .groups = "drop") %>% mutate( colour = c("lightgray", "lightgray", "#0072B2"), #009E73 name = glue("{Species}"), name = fct_reorder(name, mean_petal_width) ) %>% ggplot(aes( x = name, y = mean_petal_width, fill = colour )) + geom_col() + hrbrthemes::theme_ipsum() + scale_fill_identity() + labs( x = NULL, y = NULL, title = "Virginica irises have the largest average sepal width" ) + theme( plot.title = element_markdown(), axis.text.x = element_markdown(), legend.position = "none" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](colouring_text_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Having them all coloured ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} iris %>% group_by(Species) %>% summarise(mean_petal_width = mean(Petal.Width), .groups = "drop") %>% mutate( colour = c("#91529e", "#009E73", "#0072B2"), #009E73 name = glue("{Species}"), name = fct_reorder(name, mean_petal_width) ) %>% ggplot(aes( x = name, y = mean_petal_width, fill = colour )) + geom_col() + hrbrthemes::theme_ipsum() + scale_fill_identity() + labs( x = NULL, y = NULL, title = "Virginica irises have the largest average sepal width" ) + theme( plot.title = element_markdown(), axis.text.x = element_markdown(), legend.position = "none" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
